评论概述: A Solid Alternative to The Ridge Wallet!
评论详情: If you're in the market for a sleek, minimalist wallet but don't want to break the bank, the Vanta Vault wallet is an incredible option. I've been using it for a few weeks now, and I’m genuinely impressed by its quality and design.  First off, the wallet’s compact size makes it easy to slip into any pocket without the bulk of a traditional wallet. Despite its slim profile, it holds everything I need—from multiple credit cards to cash. The aluminum body feels sturdy and durable, giving off a premium vibe without the premium price tag.  The RFID-blocking technology is also a great feature, providing peace of mind in today’s digital world. It’s clear that Vanta Vault took a page out of more expensive brands’ books, like the Ridge, but managed to deliver a comparable product for a fraction of the cost.  Overall, if you’re looking for a stylish, functional, and affordable wallet, Vanta Vault is a fantastic choice. It does exactly what it promises without any frills, and I couldn't be happier with the value!

评论概述: Didn't expect to like this as much as I do
评论详情: Comes with a screwdriver, spare screws, and spare elastic. The "plates" are pretty thin, thinner than some other similar wallets I've seen. This is a plus for me as part of the reason I've shied away from this style of wallet is the wallet itself can be quite bulky. The included money clip is nice and sturdy. All parts fit together well and finishes are smooth. The titanium face plates come with a bit of heat treatment that's not fantastic, but still attractive. Mine is holding 5 cards and some etc business cards well. Getting cards in and out is a bit difficult, but I imagine it'll break-in in time and this will get easier.

For the price, it works. This is a great example of you get what you pay for. Is it titanium??? It feels pretty flimsy. The fit and finish are also pretty poor. There is an edge that catches on a lot of stuff because the plates aren’t the same size. I would recommend the ridge wallet over this but it is 5x as much. I doubt I will keep this.

There's not really a lot to say about a minimalist wallet. I mean it's MINIMALLIST.  This one does seem nice. It comes in a nice box, with a cool looking hex head screw driver and a little baggie of extra screws. Also included is an elastic band that can wrap around this for added security I guess? (I'm not sure what the band is for honestly.)  It holds my cards all pretty security and makes them easy to get at by having an indent you can use to push them out the opposite side. The outer shells are some kind of annealed metal and look just like they do in the photos. The inner shells are also metal (I expected plastic so bonus points!)  It's all held together by an elastic band. This is the one spot of worry I have. I don't know how long the elastic will last before it becomes worn out or just brittle. I'd imagine this wallet has a decent life span but it's not likely a "forever" wallet.  All in all, a solid buy for the price! It's light, holds my cards well and looks kind of cool. I'm guessing with more age it'll patina some and look even cooler.
I got the carbon fiber and then my girl wanted titanium,compared to ridge wallet you get more value and better deal, I think nothing matches this price tag.

I've used this wallet for a few days now, and it is small enough to be comfortable and effective in blocking signal. I have had the opportunity to try and read the cards inside using several different NFC/RFID terminals and the wallet blocks reading. The wallet is a bit larger than the cards inside, so it is unobtrusive if you like a small wallet, and the money clip can be easily removed using the enclosed screwdriver. The reason I knocked one star off is because removing the cards for use is awkward. The small cut-out what allows for pushing the cards out reveals all cards as one block of cards, forcing you to have to essentially remove all of them to select the card you want. Overall, it is a good wallet that does what it claims.

I'm very impressed with the quality of this minimalist wallet.  I've had several over the years, most are plastic and oversized livestrong style rubber bands.  This is on the higher end, made of beautifully finished titanium.  It feels lightweight but premium.

This wallet is very light. Which is a plus for me since I don’t like a lot in my pockets. I try to keep things as minimal as possible. It ships with the money clip installed but also has a band that can be used instead. There is a screwdriver to remove the screws and extra screws included. The metal has a nice feel to it The only thing I’d change is the burnt titanium design. I wish it was a little more pronounced instead of a small portion of the wallet surface I am very happy with the wallet!

评论概述: Vanta Vault - Titanium Edition - Will it be your EDC?
评论详情: Long before "every day carry" and "minimalist wallet" were added to the popular lexicon, I have carried a slim, all-leather "pocket" to hold cash and cards. The years have caught up to it, so it was time to investigate something new.  The Vanta Vault is in the category of "sandwich" card holders: two plates pulled together by an elasticized band with a cut-out for card access. If you already know you like this style of minimalist wallet, thoughtful design details contribute to a sense of quality in this product. - All metal design, with a black-anodized, machined aluminum internal plates and bolted-on titanium covers. - The internal plates are chamfered on the edge where cards slide in, allowing a card to slide in with ease. - The matte-finish titanium covers are beveled on all sides, blending gracefully into the edge. - The blueing of the metal is not a painted-on coloring, but appears to be integral to the metal. - While every effort had been made to reduce the size, the construction is rigid and the assembled unit gave no signs of deflection or deformation while applying moderate stress. - Securely holds from 1 to a dozen cards with effective RFID reader blocking.  My criticisms are not specific to the Vanta Vault, but apply generally to this style of "card sandwich" wallet. - The elastic strap is an the obvious Achilles heel of the setup, as it will undoubtedly lose its elasticity as it ages. A failure of the strap would result in the contents falling out freely. - The smooth outer surfaces left me nervous that it would be more likely to slide out of a pocket than a a leather wallet. - If the card you're looking for is not on the end of the stack, all the cards need to come out. While not deal-breakers, they make for a different experience that a traditional wallet where cards are sorted into pockets.  For me, it may not be my EDC, but I can give the Vanta Vault no less than 5 stars for its attractive design, satisfying craftsmanship and overall top-notch execution of the sandwich style of minimalist wallet. At this price point, it can't be beat.  Photo: Tear-down shows, from the top, two internal plates (0.1" thick each), two titanium covers (0.036" thick each), 2.0mm hex-head driver, the internal elastic strap, instruction card, package of screws (includes 4 extra), cash strap, and the metal money clip. Overall thickness when empty is about 0.270".

评论概述: Solid choice for a minimalist wallet
评论详情: I had been curious to try a Ridge wallet but was turned off by the high price, especially considering I wasn't sure if this was the right type of wallet for me. Instead I decided to try a low cost alternative, just to see whether I could work without all the extra stuff I usually carry around.  This Vanta Vault wallet came in a box along with a screwdriver to allow you to remove the plates. This lets you switch between the metallic money clip or the elastic strap. I chose the strap so there's less chance of getting hooked on my pocket.  The construction feels solid and it looks nice. There was enough room for a fair amount of cards, as well as for my Pebblebee tracker. So far it seems to be working well.  I'm still trying to determine whether or not I like this form factor of wallet in general, and the Vanta Vault is a perfect way to test this out before making a big investment on a name brand. And honestly I don't think there is much of a reason to even go with a name brand other than if there's some design you really like: this will get the job done just fine.

The wallet is slim and because it is metallic, it is heavy.  I like the weight of this wallet because I can feel the weight in my pocket and be assured that it is there as compared to some cheaper slim wallets that are made out of plastic and so light that you don't know it's there.  It is much slimmer than your typical leather wallet.

Hubby needed a new hard wallet because a screw feel out of his current model. So, first off, this comes with extra screws and a custom screwdriver. If you lose a screw, you don't have to throw the whole thing out. Outside of that, it's a standard hard case wallet. I really like the mirror/holographic finish on it.

The fit and finish of the Wallet is of the highest quality. The carbon fiber is perfectly polished. The money clip works perfectly. There is a free screwdriver included with the wallet and it’s not some cheap throw away item. This wallet will last for years to come and for the price this is an amazing purchase you won’t regret it.

评论概述: Great for cash and maybe two cards
评论详情: This wallet looks really nice right out of the box. It comes with the money clip as well as the band, which is very nice. I actually prefer the band over the money clip. It can hold a lot of cards, like six or so, but it is hard to fan the cards out. I prefer using it with just a couple of cards and some money in the band. If you like money clips, this is one of the nicer ones. It is wide and strong, so no fear of losing any money.

I am impressed with the quality of this wallet. I primarily got it to use as a business card holder but I may switch over to using it as my wallet. It is well made and looks good. The included screw driver is also nice. I do like how you receive a money clip as well as a strap you can change to.
